Title: Financial Analyst (Temporary/Rotation) - Tiverton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Posting Open: December 6, 2021
Posting Close: December 20, 2021
Are you looking for a meaningful career that makes a difference in your community and beyond? Are you an outdoors person who enjoys the benefits of small town living? At Bruce Power, we offer exciting careers that provide you the opportunity to have the small-town lifestyle. As part of our team, you will work in a Safety First environment supporting challenging and impactful nuclear projects like the Life Extension program. Ongoing training and development are part of every job, ensuring constant growth and skill-building potential.
We seek to enhance our team through the recruitment of an experienced, high potential individual to the role of temporary Financial Analyst for up to 24 months.
The successful candidate will be responsible for client and decision support, cost reporting, budgeting, variance analysis and business analytics, forecasting, business planning support. In addition, this role may be responsible for month end tasks including journal entries, reporting, forecasting, preparation of working papers, recording financial obligations and transactions in the financial system, and conducting financial reviews of critical business areas including business case analysis. This person must be able to demonstrate ability to work within strict deadlines, work independently and produce quality output in a rapid work environment.
Key Responsibilities
Provide support to the Finance department in carrying out the accountabilities in accordance with applicable legislation, programs, policies, procedures and agreements
Provide advice, guidance and general day to day financial system maintenance and user support to the finance team to carry out their financial functions efficiently
Maintain a professional awareness in relation to current accounting practice, IFRS/GAAP, and general business environment and the utility industry and be able to communicate impacts and implications throughout the business
Support management reporting requirements (e.g., internal financial statements, performance reports, Statistics Canada, other internal reports and ad-hoc reports) utilizing financial systems and other inputs.
Provide business reviews in critical areas such as overtime, contract management and outages.
Provide business case analyses in support of key purchase and investment decisions
Support client groups in the managing of their budgets & business plans
Conduct detailed analysis of financial information, systems and processes as required
Provide support for the financial and system audits
Maintain desktop procedures documentation current on system maintenance and support activities
Skills & Knowledge
Theoretical knowledge and relevant experience within the designated discipline is required
Demonstrated ability to achieve task results consistent with requirements for safety, quality, quantity, timeliness, and resource allowance
Able to demonstrate capability related to; analytical thinking & problem solving, work planning & organizing, and communication skills
Demonstrated motivation and commitment to achieving organizational goals and to continual improvement
Demonstrated ability to persuade and influence others, and to convey clear expectations and goals.
Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as part of a team and to lead others towards common goals
Requires knowledge of academic subjects of financial accounting practices, principles, and concepts; management accounting and control; audit, financial management including planning, budgeting and performance reporting, decision support systems, business economics, information systems and relevant computer skills
Requires good interpersonal skills and knowledge of communication techniques
Requires good communication skills, both oral and written, to facilitate effective communications with others
Requires a good understanding of the interrelationships and role of organizational units, interrelationships between work groups, external contractors and consultants involved, and the mechanics of resolving any controversial issues
Education and Experience
This knowledge is normally considered to be acquired through the successful completion of a four-year university education in a relevant discipline, or attainment of a professional accounting designation (i.e. CPA) or by having the equivalent level of education such as an MBA
A professional accounting designation (i.e. CPA) may be preferred depending on the location of the role
Requires experience in an Accounting or Financial environment to achieve a level of proficiency sufficient to understand all aspects of the Management Accounting & Planning or Corporate Financial functions
Requires some practical experience in the working with various line functions to understand aspects of work programs and projects directly or indirectly associated with financial operations
A period of over 4 years and up to 6 years is considered necessary to gain this experience
Selection Criteria
Skills, Knowledge, Education, and Experience review per the above qualifications
Transferable skills (for example: effective communication, drive for accountability and results, displaying good judgement)
Past performance record and suitability for this position
Competency based interview
Are you ready for a change?
Please attach a cover letter and resume, indicating your education and experience as it relates to the Financial Analyst opportunity. We look forward to receiving your application and will be in contact with you, should you be selected for an interview.
The successful candidate will be selected based on related and required education, experience, knowledge and skills, a competency-based interview and background reference checks.

Title: Information Security Analyst - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Bank Information Security Analyst function resides within the Business Information Security Officer (BISO) organization and is responsible for information security control enforcement, cyber security awareness, reporting and enablement for the Amex Bank of Canada. The Information Security Analyst will report to the Director, Bank Information Security Officer for the Amex Bank of Canada.
Key responsibilities include:
Work with enterprise information security functions to develop secure solutions for the Amex Bank of Canada.
Subject matter expert for information Security and interface with other risk management organizations within the Amex Bank of Canada.
Identify, scope, and help mitigate information and cyber security risks.
Assist with reporting of risk indicator metrics and demonstrate the effectiveness of the information and cyber security program to the senior management and bank leadership.
Consult on business & technology initiatives to ensure security requirements are integrated into the design.
Respond to audits and manage examination requirements in support of the BISO organization.
Operate as part of the extended Technology Risk and Information Security team in support of various security and compliance projects.
Actively contribute to the Amex Bank of Canada Information Security Risk Working Group and the management of the bank’s cyber security risk profile.
Required Work Experience, Education, Certification / Training:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
Possess relevant professional certifications (CISSP, CRISC, CISA, PCI, CISM or equivalent)
At least 3 years of work experience in Technology Risk and Information (Cyber) Security.
Technical background with hands-on experience across a variety of technologies.
Proficiency in information security, risk management, and audit policies, standards, and controls.
Knowledge of the Canadian Information Security laws and regulations.
Required Skills:
Experience working with Regulators and within complex regulated environments.
Broad understanding of information security disciplines with an emphasis on vulnerability management, data protection, infrastructure security, application security, identity and access management, incident management and data analytics.
Strong risk management skills and the ability to link threats to risk tolerance and control effectiveness.
Broad technical and business understanding of: security architecture; security engineering; threat management; vulnerability management; electronic discovery; computer and data breach incident management; data protection; forensics; 3rd party/vendor management; security monitoring; cryptography; cloud security; security operations and administration; access management; security policies and standards; security awareness; business continuity; disaster recovery; IT risk management and controls; web security; data security; network security; system security, technology operations and compliance.
Strong knowledge and experience in risk management and quantitative risk management techniques.
Knowledge of Information Security standards and regulatory requirements.
Excellent communication skills.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
